results.title: Goals for the future
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
One of a series of films contrasting child care in China, Israel, Russia and Sweden with Britain. Considers such topics as family breakdown, violence and vandalism, and alienation in youth.

results.title: Passage Out of Paradise
results.brief_description: A thousand miles in an open outrigger canoe, voyaging through some of the most beautiful islands and most treacherous waters on earth! This is the challenge accepted by nine crews from all over the world who gather in Bali to sail through the Indonesian archipelago, across the Timor Sea to Darwin. For crews of young men and women from Australia, U.K., Holland, Germany, France, Japan, U.S.A., New Zealand and Indonesia, it was an adventure that they will never forget.

results.title: Part time parent, full time job
results.creator_credit: Eurfron Gwynne Jones, Dick Foster and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Parents and Children”.
Society expects parents to be both workers and up-bringers. Two societies have made conscious attempts to resolve the conflict between the world of work and the family - Sweden and the Israeli Kibbutz.

results.title: Passage
results.creator_credit: Normand Gregoire, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film shows the capacity of the camera to suspend or speed up the viewer’s perception of motion. It is a film without words or people, where the screen is alive with light, movement and sound. Fleeting impressions are greatly accelerated as from the windows of a speeding train. The sun rockets through a vortex of clouds, light flickers — all to the shythm of chattering wheels.

results.title: A Child's place
results.creator_credit: Eurfron Gwynne Jones, Dick Foster and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
Looks at the system of daycare for young children in Israel, USSR, China and Sweden.The film asks “Where are the children? Who are they with? and what are they doing?”.

results.title: Pascali's island
results.creator_credit: James Dearden, Eric Fellner, Initial Productions (US) and Avenue Pictures
results.brief_description: For more than twenty years Basil Pascali (Ben Kingsley) has been a government spy on a Greek island in the Aegean reporting back to Constantinople. By 1908 he is accustomed to the lack of response on his reports and the monthly payment which has remained the same. Upon the arrival of an Englishman, Anthony Bowles (Charles Dance), who claims to be an archaeologist, he is quick to offer his services as an interpreter and negotiates a temporary lease on an area of land on the island. Pascali’s second mistake is to introduce the Englishman to Lydia (Helen Mirren), a Viennese painter for whom he nurses an unrequited passion and watches helplessly as they begin a passionate affair. When, by chance Bowles discovers a priceless statue, he invites Pascali to share in his joy, but the offer of genuine friendship goes unnoticed by the ever suspicious Pascali. This event leads to a betrayal that destroys his only chance of escaping the island. Based on the novel by Barry Unsworth.

results.title: Party – Christine Anu
results.brief_description: The third single off her debut album, Party (1995) remains Christine Anu’s biggest hit to date. On the surface, the clip seems consistent with other upbeat, pop videos of the 90s with overlaid images and montages to match the mood of the song. However, Anu cleverly incorporated her Torres Strait Islander heritage into the video with choreography that was a mix of traditional dances and modern styles, not to mention a diverse cast of extras and backup dancers.

results.title: Partnership
results.creator_credit: Waldemar Kuri, Karl Gschrey, Otto Martini and Gesellschaft Fur Bildende Filme
results.brief_description: Aid to underdeveloped countries providing food and work for millions. To achieve this end in countries such as India, Pakistan and Egypt, centuries have to be bridged. The main goal is not merely to provide financial aid and material goods but to work in partnership and material goods but to work in partnership and material goods but to work in partnership to develop natural resources and train skilled workers. Examples of projects undertaken include power stations, sugar refineries, cement factories, textile mills, and Rourkela, the largest iron and steel works in Asia.

results.title: Paris, Texas [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Wim Wenders, Anatole Dauman, Don Guest, Road Movies and Argos Films
results.brief_description: Directed by Wim Wenders (Wings of desire, The Million dollar hotel, Buena Vista Social Club) “Paris, Texas” won three awards at the Cannes Film Festival in 1984, including the Golden Palm. Travis (Harry Dean Stanton) is travelling aimlessly through Texas, having left behind his son in LA with his successful brother Walt (Dean Stockwell). Found half dead in the desert, Travis decides to go back for his son and take him on a journey in search of the boy’s mother (Nastassja Kinski). Their search ends in a cheap strip-joint and Travis and his ex-wife confront each other about lost dreams and past betrayals. Visually striking, and intellectually stimulating, “Paris, Texas” is scripted by Sam Shepard and based on his own volume of short stories, “Motel chronicles”. The haunting musical score is by Ry Cooder.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wim Wenders, Anatole Dauman, Don Guest, Road Movies and Argos Films
